titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of Holdings at the University of Houston Libraries

titlepage.author: Samantha Herber, Mikaela Selley, Vanco Hua, Lanchi Pham, Syed Chowdhury, and Bobby Marlin, Fall 2006

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

did.abstract: The Office of University Relations along with the Office of Development comprises the Division of University Advancement, which works to advance the institution both externally and internally. The Office of University Relations supports the university through the offices of internal and external communications, publications, and marketing. The Office of External Communications generates communications pieces, such as news releases to the media, and responses to media inquiries on behalf of the university. The collection dates from 1948-1997 with most of the materials dating from 1977 to 1997.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Office of University Relations along with the Office of Development comprises the Division of University Advancement, which works to advance the institution both externally and internally. The Office of University Relations supports the university through the offices of internal and external communications, publications, and marketing. The Office of External Communications generates communications pieces, such as news releases to the media, and responses to media inquiries on behalf of the university. Its goal is to ensure information about the university and its colleges is communicated accurately and timely to the public via the news media, both local and beyond. The Office of Internal Communications disseminates major university news and events to faculty, staff and students. The Office of University Marketing seeks to enhance the University of Houston's efforts to bolster the image of the university.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection arrived at the archives in relatively good order and in general the original order has been maintained. Materials in the collection include departmental records, extensive press clippings, and videos. The collection dates from 1948-1997 with most of the materials dating from 1977 to 1997. The collection is organized into four series: Faculty Vitas, Departmental Records, Press Clippings, and Audio Visual Materials. The collection did contain a sizable amount of photographic materials in all formats (slides, negatives, prints, contact sheets, etc), that have been separated to form the UH Historic Photographs Collection. The Office of University Relations also contained a large number of faculty vitas that were transferred to the Faculty Vita Records: 1969-066.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

controlaccess.head: Corporate Name:
controlaccess.corpname: University of Houston--Office of University Relations

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The material in this collection is in the public domain. However, Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, and all reproduction restrictions apply.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: University Relations Records, Courtesy of Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from Office of University Relations.

scopecontent.p: This series contains one hundred and seventy-four folders, arranged alphabetically. It consists of City Council Awards given to faculty members, annual reports, reports to the community and various other files used within the department. Materials in this series date from 1948-1997 and are arranged alphabetically.

Your Hometown News Houston Post Series

scopecontent.p: This series contains twenty-seven folders dating from 1977-1980, arranged alphabetically. The folders contain materials including invitations, guest lists, receipts, memos, and other items related to the preparations necessary for these events. The original order has been maintained except where items were obviously miss-filed.

did.unittitle: College of Optometry, Building Invitation List
College of Pharmacy, Texas Medical Center
College of Pharmacy, Texas Medical Center

scopecontent.p: In Memoriam are arranged alphabetically, according to the last name of the individual. Each record contains information (education, birth and death dates, place of birth, and positions held) for faculty, staff, and benefactors, associated with the university.

In Appreciation and In Resolutions are arranged alphabetically, according to the last name of the individual. Each record contains information for each person or benefactors associated with the university, and outline the major accomplishments of those persons or entities.

In Resolution are arranged alphabetically, according to the last name of the individual or organization. Each record contains information for faculty, staff, and benefactors, associated with the university and outline the major accomplishments of those persons or entities

did.unittitle: The Attainment of Excellence in the Athletics Program
Dr. and Mrs. Richard J. Gonzalez

scopecontent.p: Silver Anniversary Certificates are arranged alphabetically, according to the last name of the individual and are divided into three categories; Faculty and Staff, Former Faculty Members, and Recognized Faculty. Each record contains information for faculty and staff associated with the university and outlines the major accomplishments of the individuals.
S. W. Henderson Floy P. Soule A. W. French E. M. Schuhmann Jules A. Vern M. A. Miller A. L. Kerbow

Frederic Browne Mrs. Bessie Ebaugh Dr. C. F. Hiller Dr. Alva Kerbow Dr. Louis Kestenberg C. F. McElhinney L. Standlee Mitchell Miss Zelda Osborne Warren Rees Mrs. Lillian Warren Dr. Joseph S. Werlin Mrs. Ruth Wikoff

This series contains ninety-one folders dating from 1977-1997, arranged chronologically by month. The articles relate to a variety of university topics including, athletics, special events, awards and many others. However, the amount of informational content within the clippings varies greatly. Some articles are extensive or in-depth in nature where others may include only a brief mention of the university or a direct quote by a faculty member. The original order was chronological which has been maintained except where items were obviously miss-filed.

This series consists of a variety of audio and video tapes including one-inch video, three quarter inch Umatic, VHS, one-eighth inch reel to reel audio, audio cassettes, and several others. Most of them contain public service announcements relating to various university departments or events. The photographs that were originally part of this series have been removed and placed with all other University of Houston historic photographs.
